name: Ribbed Beanie
description: This is a great, simple beanie to knit up for that deserving person in your life. It might be a loving partner, a sweet relative, or even your good ol’ self! No matter who, they’ll be sure to get a kick out of a new, cozy beanie like this one.
full_text: This is a great, simple beanie to knit up for that deserving person in your life. It might be a loving partner, a sweet relative, or even your good ol’ self! No matter who, they’ll be sure to get a kick out of a new, cozy beanie like this one. It’s a great project for newbies learning to knit in the round, and a simple, mindless one for those more experienced. Either way, it should be fun, quick and easy! MATERIALS Sizes: Adult - approximately 52cm measured around head. Dimensions: Finished length: 22cm from crown to cuff. Crown length: 6cm. Yarn: Any 8ply / DK weight yarn. We used Woolly 8ply (104m/50g) in Olive You Lots Quantity: 2 balls or approx 160m Needle: 3.50mm circular needles: 40cm for body of hat and 80cm for Magic Loop Gauge: 24-26sts x 30rows to 10cm in rib pattern, slightly stretched Materials: 6 stitch markers, yarn needle for sewing up
